title: Coventry
summary: Coventry (/ˈkɒvəntri/ (listen) KOV-ən-tree[5] or /ˈkʌv-/ KUV-)[6] is a city in the West Midlands, England. It is on the River Sherbourne. Coventry has been a large settlement for centuries, although it was not founded and given its city status until the Middle Ages. The conurbation consists of the Coventry and Bedworth Urban Area, the 20th largest in the country; the city is governed by Coventry City Council.
